programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: Inaugural golf league combines advanced technology with teams, which are made up of PGA TOUR players representing six different cities, facing off in a head-to-head competition; Boston Common Golf (0-0-1) vs. Los Angeles Golf Club (0-0-1) in Week 5.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 20 Arizona (15-6, 9-1) won four straight after an 81-72 win over rival Arizona State behind 27 points from Caleb Love, who is fifth in the Big 12 with 16.2 ppg; BYU (15-6, 6-4) won its last four games, and is 11-1 at home behind Richie Saunders.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 14 Kentucky (15-6, 4-4) won 14 of the last 15 meetings with the Rebels after a 75-63 win last season; No. 25 Ole Miss (16-6, 5-4) lost four of its last five, but is 10-2 at home behind Sean Pedulla, who leads the Rebels with 15.2 ppg.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.desc: Oklahoma City claimed wins over Phoenix in all three of their meetings in 2023-24, including the final matchup on March 29, 128-103, led by Josh Giddey's 23 points and 9 assists; Kevin Durant posted 26 points and 6 rebounds for the Suns in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Basketball

programme.title: NBA Courtside

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: San Antonio claimed a 133-126 overtime win over Atlanta in their first meeting of the season on Dec. 19 behind Victor Wembanyama's 42 points and 6 rebounds; the Hawks' De'Andre Hunter posted 27 points while Trae Young added 16 assists in the loss.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Connecticut and Tennessee last met in 2023, where the Huskies claimed an 84-67 victory over the Volunteers behind 26 points from Lou Lopez Sénéchal and 25 from Aaliyah Edwards; Jordan Horston posted 27 points and 7 rebounds for Tennessee in the loss.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The hosts do a top 10 countdown as they take an in-depth look at many of the greatest moments in the history of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, and examine the most brutal knockouts, stunning upsets and devastating brawls.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Baylor (14-7, 6-4) came back from a 19-point deficit at halftime to beat then-No. 11 Kansas, 81-70, behind 24 points from Robert Wright III: No. 13 Texas Tech (17-4, 8-2) won six-straight games, and is 11-2 at home behind Chance McMillan.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: German Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Leverkusen claimed victories over Köln in three of their last four meetings, including the most recent matchup on March 3 with a 2-0 scoreline; Jeremie Frimpong and Alejandro Grimaldo found the net for Leverkusen in the league win away from home.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Drake (20-2, 10-2) won eight-straight games behind Bennett Stirtz, who leads the MVC in scoring with 18.4 ppg; Murray State (11-12, 5-7) beat the Bulldogs, 66-59, on Jan. 5 behind 20 points from Terence Harcum and 15 from Kylen Milton.

programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The 2000 Baltimore Ravens featured one of the most dominating defenses in NFL history and some of the more unique personalities throughout their roster as they shut down opposing teams on their way to a Super Bowl XXXV title over the New York Giants.

programme.desc: Analysts cover National Signing Day, focusing on the top recruits from across the nation being signed by each program to fill positional needs, class rankings to see who is best in the nation and each conference, as well as the top surprises.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 Duke (19-2, 11-0) won 15-straight games behind freshman Cooper Flagg, who is second in the ACC in scoring with 20 ppg, and won the last nine meetings; Syracuse (10-12, 4-7) ended a three-game skid with a 75-66 win over Cal, and is 8-4 at home.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.title: ESPN Original Documentaries
programme.desc: The life and career of Eugene F. "Buddy" Teevens III is celebrated, showcasing the groundbreaking innovations he brought to college football during his coaching tenure which spanned four decades and the impact he made off the field.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgetown (14-8, 5-6) defeated the Musketeers, 69-63, on Jan. 3 behind 26 points from Malik Mack after losing the previous five meetings; Xavier (13-9, 5-6) is 10-2 at home behind Zach Freemantle, who is fifth in the Big East with 16.5 ppg.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: New Mexico claimed a 78-74 victory over Colorado State in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 18, led by 25 points and 11 rebounds from Vianè Cumber; Emma Ronsiek posted 29 points and 11 rebounds for the Rams in the home defeat.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series heads to Bowman Gray Stadium in Winston-Salem, North Carolina for the first of two exhibition races in the 2025 season; Bowman Gray Stadium is back to hosting the NASCAR Cup Series for the first time since 1971.

programme.title: The Facility Best of Football Show

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Georgetown (14-8, 5-6) defeated the Musketeers, 69-63, on Jan. 3 behind 26 points from Malik Mack after losing the previous five meetings; Xavier (13-9, 5-6) is 10-2 at home behind Zach Freemantle, who is fifth in the Big East with 16.5 ppg.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Indy claimed a 3-2 victory over Columbus in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 18, led by a 29-kill, 18-dog performance from outside hitter Leketor Member-Meneh; Fury outside hitter Raina Terry posted 22 kills and 13 digs in the loss.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Strasbourg and Angers played to a 1-1 draw in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 15 which saw Ahmadou Bamba Dieng equalize for Angers in the 63rd minute; Sebastian Nanasi had opened the scoring for Strasbourg in the 32nd minute.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Mexican side Cruz Azul is tied with defending champion Pachuca for the second-most titles with six since the tournament debuted in 1962, while Real Hope looks to join Racing Club Haïtien and Violette AC as Haitian clubs to win the tournament.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Players bowl three rounds of 24 games across three oil patterns to qualify for round robin play; Graham Fach comes off of returning to the winner's circle in the Delaware Classic at Mid-County Lanes & Entertainment Center in Middletown, Delaware.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Top contenders Kyle Troup, Anthony Simonsen, Jason Belmonte, EJ Tackett and Bill O'Neill featured in the 2024 U.S. Open's championship round; Graham Fach comes off of returning to the winner's circle at the Delaware Classic in Middletown, Delaware.

programme.desc: Troyes and Brest last met in March 2023 where they played to a 2-2 draw.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Mexican side Tigres UANL is unbeaten in each of the two all-time meetings with El Tren del Norte after the teams played to a 1-1 draw at Estadio Independencia on Sept. 18; Real Estelí has lost three of its last four CONCACAF Champions Cup contests.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Bourgoin's last action was a round of 32 win over Lyon on Jan. 15 after penalties of a 2-2 draw in which Mehdi Moujetzky had a brace; Reims beat Monaco through penalties after a 1-1 draw on Jan. 14 where Cédric Kipré opened the scoring for Reims.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Teams compete in the 54-hole, season-opening event, as golfers play under the lights at night for a $25 million purse in the first-ever LIV Golf tournament held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Jon Rahm (individual) and Ripper GC (team) won 2024 titles.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Mexican club Monterrey has won five titles since 2010 after defeating rival Club América in the final of the 2021 edition, 1-0, while Canadian side Forge FC is 0-0-4 all-time in the tournament after falling to Guadalajara, 2-1, on Feb. 13.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Two-time Daytona 500 winner Bobby Allison picked up his fifth win at the 2.5-mile oval in the Firecracker 400 the previous year, as Bobby and his son, Davey, would make history in the 30th running of the prestigious NASCAR race.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Jeff Gordon was coming off his second Cup Series title in three years, including a win at the 1997 Daytona 500, while seven-time Cup Series champion Dale Earnhardt sought his first win at the prestigious race that continued to elude him.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Mexican club Guadalajara is 2-0-0 all-time against Dominican side Cibao after earning a 5-0 victory in the second leg of their Round of 16 matchup in the 2018 edition, as Carlos Cisneros scored and added an assist in the second half.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
LIV Golf
programme.desc: Teams compete in the 54-hole, season-opening event, as golfers play under the lights at night for a $25 million purse in the first-ever LIV Golf tournament held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Jon Rahm (individual) and Ripper GC (team) won 2024 titles.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Pumas UNAM returns to the tournament for the first time since 2022; Cavalry FC is 0-0-2 all-time in the tournament after suffering a 3-1 setback to MLS side Orlando City in the second leg of their first-round matchup in 2024.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Curaçao U17 was outscored, 21-3, in its three matches in the 2023 edition; Bermuda U17 has split two all-time meetings with Curaçao after earning a 4-0 victory in a group stage match at the 2001 edition jointly held by Honduras and the United States.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.
